channel.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
channel.description:
Of all the monsters in RS, why does everyone use Rock Crabs to initiate combat training in an RSPS? One could simply edit the stats of a much more interesting NPC to kill and make the grind that much more interesting. I mean, haven't we all had more than our fair share of killing Rock Crabs? Greater Demons, Hell Hounds, Orcs, Animated Armours, Minotaurs, Baby Dragons, Gnomes, AND SO MUCH MORE! I mean heck there are an infinite amount of options, yet everyone chooses the boring old generic Rock Crabs.
What are your opinions on this? If you are a server owner/coder, will you attempt to break this habit? And if you could choose a training monster, what would it be?

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @runeslaer25 runeslaer25

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:10, topic:526027”]i just took this in lol

I’m definitely changing to something new now. Maybe rats or zombies though :|[/quote]

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Edgeville is just a quick way to go pvp people and plus people don’t want to look for a unique spot and get its coords.

ps: I love Edgeville for my first reason, but I think you shouldn’t have just one home what about expanding it such as Edgeville is the pvp district and all pvp related stuff do in Edgeville

item.source: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

mrnessie:

it depends…, if its a remake then you want it like that… u dont want a man with 700 hp for training…

Well yeah, obviously remakes aren’t part of this discussion, as you want everything as close to a real RS server as possible.

Uncalled:

Most people use rock crabs because they’re designed for a training monster. They’re a low level, can hardly hit you, and have 50hp. That’s a pretty solid number if you wish to do calculations on your skills and such. That’s also why servers that have them use Yaks. They’re designed for the exact same thing. Another NPC that I’m surprised isn’t used as often is experiments. They are also low level monsters that have a larger amount of health. Sure, if you want to be unique you could have your members fighting ice giants and such. Though, if one wishes to have a more realistic server - then fighting ice giants would be rather distasteful. I suppose you could have a training location mixed with all sorts of different monsters and still be more RS-like. Though, there’s also reason as to what Lin stated. But I’ve seen very well developed servers still using rock crabs, so it’s not entirely based on that.

Even if they’re a good server, it’s still lazy. I mean why not have low defense, high HP ice giants? I would enjoy killing Ice giants a lot more than a conspicuous looking lumps of rock over and over again.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

create multiple arrays of monsters of different difficulties (kinda like the nooby slayer systems)
spawn one monster (randomly) and set it’s hp to 25000. every 250 damage dealt, use the npc transformation mask to transforms the npc into a new monster with same hp, etc etc. to remove the use of afk-ing it for the (25000hp*xprate) experience, simply transform it to a difficult monster every 3500 or so damage done.
if the player leaves the (instanced) region, delete the npc.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

I think a lot of people are looking for unique content in the wrong places… I don’t really give a shit about where I train in an rsps.

I do think it would be cool to get all dungeons in RS into your server, fully integrated, though.

item.title: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Lin:

When I hosted my server, for training, I had a room full of all sorts of monsters of medium-high levels. They would drop tickets and you could exchange the tickets for items. I think minigame sorts of things are a great way to have training, or at least have dungeons and multiple places to train. Look how RuneScape does it.

yeah i remember your server was pretty awesome especially smh integrated was pretty cool

Lin:

Why have the same shops? Why use the same shopkeepers? Why use Edgeville? Why have the same teleports and boss fights? Because people who host servers are lazy and uncreative.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does everyone use Rock Crabs?
